title: Add s3:DeleteObject to recommended policy
body:
*Issue #, if available:* n/a

*Description of changes:*
I was able to push successfully the first time using the recommended IAM policy, but pushing the second time resulted in the error:

```
! [remote rejected] origin/main -> origin/main (An error occurred (AccessDenied) when calling the DeleteObject operation: User: arn:aws:sts::XYZ:assumed-role/XYZ is not authorized to perform: s3:DeleteObject on resource: )
! [remote rejected] main -> main (An error occurred (AccessDenied) when calling the DeleteObject operation: User: arn:aws:sts::XYZ:assumed-role/XYZ is not authorized to perform: s3:DeleteObject on resource: )
```

This PR updates the sample policy to include s3:DeleteObject.

title: How to work with submudules
body:
Hi 

Thank you for this project!
I have been successed with clone/push/pull commands with s3 remote. 
But when i try to add submodule with s3 remote, I get error:

```
$ git submodule add s3://my-backet-name/my-repo my-repo
Cloning into '/Volumes/data/my-repo'...
fatal: transport 's3' not allowed
```

Is it possible to use submudule command with s3 remote?

Thank you!
author: pakimov2

comments.body:
Resolved by:
`git config --global protocol.s3.allow always`

Thank you!
@pakimov2 thanks for the tip. I will add to the README.

title: not executing with native install but working in .venv - on Windows
body:
After installing git-remote-s3 with pip I had this issue when trying to clone :

```
git clone s3://xxx/git-remote_xxx-iiot-cdk/
```
```
Cloning into 'git-remote_xxx-iiot-cdk'...
git: 'remote-s3' is not a git command. See 'git --help'.

The most similar command is
        remote-fd
fatal: remote helper 's3' aborted session
``` 

But it worked in a random python environment. 

Also if I add the ./venv/Scripts that contains the git-remote-s3.exe to my Path, I can clone from anywhere, but it will probably stop working if I ever delete the python environment I took the git-remote-s3.exe from.
author: KPq66dw8L

comments.body:
Hi Julien, 

did you get a message like the following when you did `pip install git-remote-s3` without using virtual envs?

```
WARNING: The script xxxx.exe is installed in
'C:\Users\uuuuuu\AppData\Local\Packages\PythonSoftwareFoundation.Python.3.XX_xxxxxxx\
LocalCache\local-packages\Python310\Scripts' which is not on PATH.
 Consider adding this directory to PATH or, if you prefer to suppress this warning,
use --no-warn-script-location.
```

Hi @massi-ang ,

I re-installed the package to check, and yes, I actually got this message. I just added this path to my PATH and everything works fine. Thanks !
